meanings.definition: trudgers (noun): people who walk slowly and heavily
meanings.sent1: The trudgers made their way up the hill, taking slow and heavy steps.
meanings.sent2: The group of trudgers moved along the path at a leisurely pace.
meanings.sent3: The trudgers looked like they were carrying invisible weights on their shoulders.
meanings.sent4: The trudgers resembled elephants marching in a line, each step echoing heavily.
meanings.sent5: The image of the trudgers plodding through the mud stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: trudgers (verb): to walk slowly and heavily
meanings.sent1: She trudgers through the snow, leaving deep footprints behind.
meanings.sent2: I trudgers home after a long day, feeling exhausted.
meanings.sent3: The tired hiker trudgers up the steep mountain, one step at a time.
meanings.sent4: The old man trudgers along the path of life, each step a struggle.
meanings.sent5: The elephant trudgers through the jungle, its massive feet thudding on the ground.
